The entire amount;
Transfer to the:
Progressive meter of a video lottery terminal with the same:
Or greater probability of winning the progressive jackpot;
Or lower wager requirement to be eligible to win the progressive jackpot; and
Type of progressive jackpot award; or
Progressive meters of two separate video lottery terminals provided each terminal to which a jackpot amount is transferred individually satisfies the requirements of §D(2)(a) of this regulation; and

Disclosure of the intent to transfer an available progressive jackpot amount on the front of a video lottery terminal in a manner specified by the Commission for at least 14 days prior to the intended date of transfer.
Removal from the gaming floor of a video lottery terminal offering a progressive jackpot under §C(3) of this regulation shall require:
If the removal involves one or more linked video lottery terminals offered in:
A single facility, that at least two linked video lottery terminals offering the same progressive jackpot remain on the gaming floor; and
More than one facility, that the facility operator retain at least one linked video lottery terminal offering the same progressive jackpot on its gaming floor; and

In every case, disclosure of the intent to transfer an available progressive jackpot on the front of a video lottery terminal in a manner specified by the Commission for at least 14 days prior to the intended date of transfer.
Nothing in this regulation shall preclude the Commission from imposing additional terms and conditions on a modification of a progressive proposal.
A manufacturer may not perform from a remote location analysis of, or technical support with regard to, a video lottery terminal without:
Submission of a written request to the Commission; and
The written approval of the Commission.
A manufacturer may perform from a remote location analysis of, or technical support with regard to, a facility operator’s video lottery systems including, but not limited to, a:
Gaming ticket system;
Promotional play system;
Player tracking system;
External bonusing system;
Cashless funds transfer system; and
Wide area progressive system.

A facility operator intending to authorize remote access to a video lottery system under this regulation shall include in its internal controls submitted for Commission approval under COMAR 36.03.10.05 a written system of access protocols which require:
A unique system account for each employee of a manufacturer identified by the manufacturer as potentially required to perform technical support from a remote location;
Use of a dedicated and secure communication facility;
The facility operator to provide the Commission with notice of access within 4 hours after a person remotely accesses a system;
The facility operator to take affirmative steps, on a per access basis, to activate a manufacturer’s access privileges;
Imposition of limits on the ability of any individual authorized under this regulation to deliberately or inadvertently interfere with:
The normal operation of the system; and
Its data; and
An access log:
Maintained by both the:
Manufacturer; and
Facility operator’s information technology department;
Maintained in:
A book with bound numbered pages that cannot be readily removed; or
An electronic format equipped with software that prevents modification of an entry after it has been initially entered into the system; and
Documenting the:
Manufacturer version number of the system accessed;
Type of connection as leased line, dial in modem, or private WAN;
Name of the manufacturer employee remotely accessing the system;
Name of the information technology department employee activating the manufacturer's access to the system;
Date and time of the connection;
Duration of the connection;
Reason for the remote access including a description of the symptoms or malfunction prompting the need for remote access to the system; and
Any action taken or further action required.
A facility operator may not authorize a manufacturer to remotely access a video lottery system until its system access protocols are approved in writing by the Commission.
Any modification to a system required to be tested, certified, and approved by the Commission under Regulation .02E of this chapter shall be processed as:
An emergency modification under Regulation .07 of this chapter; or
A standard modification under Regulations .03C and .04C of this chapter.
If an employee of a manufacturer is no longer employed or authorized by a manufacturer to remotely access a system pursuant to this regulation, the manufacturer shall:
Immediately notify in writing:
Any facility operator that has established a unique system account for that employee of the change in authorization; and
The Commission; and
Verify with each facility operator notified of the change in authorization that the access privileges of the individual have been revoked.

section.heading: Manufacturer Storage of Equipment, Systems, and Software Outside a Facility.

para.text: A manufacturer may not utilize a location outside of a facility to store or repair equipment, systems, software, or related parts and inventory for use in a facility without the storage facility being:
Inspected by the Commission; and
Approved in writing by the Commission.
A manufacturer shall locate a storage facility in Maryland in a location or locations that reasonably permit the delivery of the support and technical services to which the manufacturer is obligated.
A manufacturer shall submit to the Commission a written request to utilize a storage facility under §A of this regulation which includes, at a minimum:
The address;
A physical description of the storage facility;
Specifications for the surveillance system that has been or will be installed at the proposed storage facility including:
If digital:
Recording frames per second; and
Common image rate; and
Proposed recording retention schedule; and
Security procedures for the storage facility.
